title: A few typefaces from sheet music books...
content:
Hello all, I’m helping some artists out with a project and need to match some typefaces from a bunch of different books of sheet music. I’ve managed to find most of them, but am stuck on these four. I’ve tried What The Font, but haven’t had any luck. Sorry about the poor image quality here—all I have is some hand-held digital photos to work from.

If you can offer any suggestions I would very much appreciate it. Even if it’s not an exact match, that’s fine. Something close to the original, or its spirit is better than nothing. Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bondekvindelag1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/typophile.com/files/bondekvindelag1.jpg) | 58.05 KB |
| [musicschool2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/typophile.com/files/musicschool2.jpg) | 42.31 KB |
| [school2\_01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/typophile.com/files/school2_01.jpg) | 40.57 KB |
| [school2\_02.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/typophile.com/files/school2_02.jpg) | 23.24 KB |

 [‹ The Leading Hotels of the World](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48236 "Go to previous forum topic") [Shaklee Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48196 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ornmnt

comments.content:
First two are Garamonds:

- _bondekvindelag1_ is Garamond Simoncini, I think
- _musicschool2_ is Adobe Garamond

The third looks like Times New Roman

- Mike Yanega

Thanks so much. I think you guys are right on for the first three.

If somebody has any ideas for the last one, I’ll be all set. I know the printing is giving it some character and there might not be an exact match, but anything close would be appreciated!

I’m not sure at all about the last one, but perhaps a [Janson](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=janson), [Belizio](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122062028/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Belizio), or Caledonia are in the ballpark?
